note: you may need to pan with the plotly GUI to view the full timeline

```{r timeline, echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE, out.height = "200%", out.width = "200%", fig.width=200, fig.height=200}
library(vistime)
suppressMessages(library(plotly))
data <- read.csv(file="data/timeline.csv")
events <- c("education", "work/study", "awards", "publications", "meetings", "experience", "other")
data <- data[order(match(data$event,events)),]
data$end[data$end=="present"] = as.character(Sys.Date())
fig <- vistime::vistime(data, optimize_y = TRUE, linewidth = 25, show_labels = TRUE)
fig <- fig %>% layout(autosize = TRUE, width = 2000, height = 2000, uniformtext=list(minsize=8, mode='hide'))
fig
```
